The Facebook pixel is a snippet of JavaScript
code that loads a collection of functions with which Facebook can track your
user actions.

For example, when you purchase a product on our website, the
Facebook pixel is triggered and stores your actions on our website in one or
more cookies.

These cookies enable Facebook to compare your user data
(customer data such as IP address, user ID) with the data of your Facebook
account.

If you yourself are a Facebook user and are logged in, your visit to our
website is automatically assigned to your Facebook user account.

Scope of data usage

When you establish your relationship with us when you place orders with us or
use our website, you provide us with personal information and possibly
business and trade secrets, both from you and, if applicable, from your

When you subscribe to our newsletter, we collect your email address and your

We may also collect other information that you voluntarily provide to us, such
as your preferences.
